title: Dear Stan Lee,
body:
I never got to say what I wanted to while you were still here. I never got to send this letter telling you how truly impactful you’ve been on my life whether you knew it or not. It’s high time I said this, though now in past tense, I guess.

You were truly one of the greatest writers with one of the most incredible minds of this age, and while the world is much smaller for your loss, the worlds you created and the universes you brought into being will continue to grow in your memory, fueled by the people and lives you touched during yours.  The depth of our collective grief can hardly be described, but the joy of your stories will bring us back into the light, and into a more beautiful, more accepting, more incredible world. There will never be another Stan Lee, but we can all strive to be as good and kind and accepting as you were in your lifetime.

You built universes with your mind. You created superheroes we could relate to as people. You showed us acceptance and kindness. You gave hope to people who thought there was none. You were an ever-present light in a world slowly falling into darkness.

The characters you gave us taught us so much, through actions and words and panels.

Iron Man taught us that mental health is a real issue, that it can affect anyone, that it is not a flaw, but an obstacle to overcome, that it CAN be overcome. Captain America told us to follow our own rules, to damn everyone else’s if they attack your morals and beliefs, to believe in ourselves, to never be afraid to do the right thing. Thor forced us to realize that strength isn’t everything, that you can be the most powerful person in the room, but that you must also be the kindest. X-Men helped us understand that being different isn’t bad, that no one is just what they are on the surface, that it’s okay to take time to learn about yourself. The Hulk reminded us that good things can come from even the worst situations, that our actions have consequences, and that we must accept them. Deadpool made us acknowledge that being “odd” is okay, that a good sense of humor is one of the most powerful forces in the world, that our appearance does not equal our worth. Doctor Strange revealed the value of skepticism and of knowledge and of learning. Hawkeye reinforced that physical impairments and disabilities are not flaws or weaknesses, that they are simply a part of us, that we are not any less than anyone else for them. Black Widow gave us a powerful woman to admire and look up to. Black Panther reminded us that hate and discrimination amount to nothing in the end, that the world can look down on us, but if we hold our heads up high and look it in the eye, confident and sure, the world will always blink first. Ant-Man proclaimed that anyone can be a hero. Spiderman showed us that with great power comes great responsibility, and that great power can come to anyone.
The Fantastic Four, the ones that started it all, taught us the value of teamwork, that even heroes have faults, and that faults do not mean “weakness” but instead mean just that, fault.

You taught us so much, but this you taught us above all: while people pass on, their legacies remain - legends never truly die.

Sincerely,
Me

title: It's All To Much
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PDjYU9

by Moonscar

Everything was just to much

It’s to much

It’s all to much

Make it stop, make it stop

summary: That's What The Flowers Are For
title: That's What The Flowers Are For
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2QQAiNP

by wolfie_slays

…and there’s nothing the pair can do but nod dumbly, emotions thick in their throats, deciding that no words exist for how much they love each other, their family. That’s what the flowers are for.

blog.name: zajelimilogin
blog.title: Dream a little bigger, darling.
blog.description:
Woman.
Determined.
Braided.

What else?
Normality is overrated.
Wibbly wobbly, timey wimey.
Black, two sugars. I'll be upstairs.
One more miracle, please.

You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling.

reblog.comment:
My favorite drama queen.

14 July 2018

trail.content_raw:
My favorite drama queen.

14 July 2018

14 July 2018

blog.name: yetanothercomicbook
blog.title: Comics
blog.description: Most of the comics I read are Marvels from 1984. Every time I read a comic, I post a comment. That's pretty much it.

title: War and Remembrance!
body:
Iron Man Annual #5

Feels more like a Black Panther story than an Iron Man one.

  • The recurring theme here is things appearing to be one thing, that are actually another. A pitch battle is revealed to be a training session, a harmless conversation is revealed to be a ruse in case of listening devices, a dead body is revealed to be a decoy, a living man is revealed to be an animated corpse, etc. And some of these work better than others.
  • Mostly it’s action all the way, as our hero’s right to the throne is under threat. Again.
  • Good twist in the final scenes.

6/10

  • The recurring theme here is things appearing to be one thing, that are actually another. A pitch battle is revealed to be a training session, a harmless conversation is revealed to be a ruse in case of listening devices, a dead body is revealed to be a decoy, a living man is revealed to be an animated corpse, etc. And some of these work better than others.
  • Mostly it’s action all the way, as our hero’s right to the throne is under threat. Again.
  • Good twist in the final scenes.

6/10

blog.description:
Love is beautiful and love is Equal. Emily | 23 | Sagittarius | INTJ |-/ Cupcake connoisseur and Uni Student who is plotting world domination. Feel free to talk to me, I get lonely sometimes.

I post a lot of random nonsense, but hopefully there'll be something here to keep you entertained.

summary: So I got drunk last night, like pretty white-girl-wasted at this point, and one of the guys I live with decided to put Iron Man...
body:
So I got drunk last night, like pretty white-girl-wasted at this point, and one of the guys I live with decided to put Iron Man on. Me, being the Stan that I am, decided that I was gonna watch it as well. WELL, let me tell you, I didn’t make it past the line “is it better to be feared or respected” before I had a fucking meltdown, and I somehow managed to get into the shower where I proceeded to cry under the running water.


That’s just something y’all needed to know. God bless Tony Stark.

summary: Y’all. My brain is so weird. I got up to go to the bathroom about 3 am and crawled back into bed, already like half back to...
body: Y’all. My brain is so weird. I got up to go to the bathroom about 3 am and crawled back into bed, already like half back to sleep, and laid there trying to remember what I was thinking about, and I suddenly realized I had been dreaming what seemed to be highlights from…Iron Man The Musical. I do not keed. I wish I could remember lyrics :D but I do remember a lot of it, like blocking and choreography and some of the book and melody lines, which is rare for me when dreaming. Some staging and effects too, and they were just amazing. I am going to write it all down so I can lol at it. Well, not really, because it was quite good actually. It felt like peeking thru a portal into another verse. So weird.

blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me...
